result.execSummary:
The defendant John Clifford McKinney #174174 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 But Does Not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: Penalty], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence the Defendant is currently serving in the WI State Prison System, including La Crosse Co. Case No. 12 CF 618.    In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution Ordered:  $3,471.89 - Pigeon Falls State Bank; $347.19 - surcharge.
Defendant is to pay court costs, including the DNA surcharge.
Defendant is to have no contact with the Pigeon Falls State Bank.
Defendant is to write the Pigeon Falls State Bank an apology letter.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED if Defendant performs 180 hours of community service at the rate of 60 hours per year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
